docs.snippet: Even if Robinson Cano would fit nicely into the Mets’ batting order behind David Wright, it seems a dinner between Cano’s representatives and the Mets front office was just that, dinner....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even if Robinson Cano would fit nicely into the Mets’ batting order behind David Wright, it seems a dinner between Cano’s representatives and the Mets front office was just that, dinner.
docs.abstract: New York Mets officials meet with representatives of New York Yankee' second baseman Robinson Cano, who is the highest-priced player on baseball’s free-agent market; representatives are asking for contract in excess of $300 million for Cano, which might be a little pricey for a Mets team that has barely spent $3 million on any free agent in recent seasons.

headline.main: Cano to the Mets? Unlikely at His Price
headline.print_headline: Cano to the Mets? Unlikely at His Price

docs.snippet: The Mexican government’s answer to drug violence is more troops and more bullets but less justice....
docs.abstract: The Mexican government’s answer to drug violence is more troops and more bullets but less justice.

docs.snippet: Too often, media content producers seem to fear technological shifts that ultimately help them grow, the author writes....
docs.abstract: Too often, media content producers seem to fear technological shifts that ultimately help them grow, the author writes.

headline.main: Broadcasters' Fight Against Aereo Doesn't Serve Their Interests

docs.snippet: In recent years, locker rooms have become crammed with multiple uniform options in a riot of colors and fabrics. Some see branding opportunities and merchandise sales while others hope to attract recruits....
docs.lead_paragraph: In recent years, locker rooms have become crammed with multiple uniform options in a riot of colors and fabrics. Some see branding opportunities and merchandise sales while others hope to attract recruits.
docs.abstract: Sports teams once had simple fashion rules, wear one uniform at home, usually white, and another on the road; in recent years, however, locker rooms have become more like Hollywood wardrobes, crammed with multiple uniform options in riot of colors and fabrics; college and professional teams see both branding opportunities and merchandise sales, and some hope to attract recruits with flashier uniforms.

headline.main: It’s a Fashion Show for Sports Teams

docs.snippet: This television season, many shows — including “Mom,” “Dads” and “The Crazy Ones” — are treating their characters over 50 as particularly immature....
docs.lead_paragraph: This television season, many shows — including “Mom,” “Dads” and “The Crazy Ones” — are treating their characters over 50 as particularly immature.
docs.abstract: Neil Genzlinger observes most current television characters over 50 years old are portrayed as vulgar, inappropriate or moronic in both comedies and dramas; suggests it may be baby boomers' comeuppance after decades of putting down younger generations.

headline.main: Kids These Days: They’re All Older Than 50
headline.print_headline: Kids These Days: They’re All Older Than 50
